answers.answer: Tough question - to get right to the point I would say yes possibly - diabetes  might make the vitreous a little less normal biochemically and more prone to vitreous degeneration.  Genetics play a large role as well as the overall structure of eye and degree of myopia.  In general, there is not much you can do to control this situation.Michael Kutryb, MD

question: Hello,Besides detachment (vitrous or other), can any hormonal or other abnormality cause a change in the structure of the collagen and thus cause floaters??ThanksJohn
title: floaters collagen cause
